intro: Attalea lydiae, commonly known as the Yacuruna palm, is a flowering plant species native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into clustered fruits, each containing a single seed. It thrives in wet, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or flooded areas. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
